member.name: T:Sandbox.BaseCarriable
member.summary: An entity that can be carried in the player's inventory and hands.

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseCarriable.ActiveStart(Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: This entity has become the active entity. This most likely means a player was carrying it in their inventory and now has it in their hands.

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseCarriable.ActiveEnd(Sandbox.Entity,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This entity has stopped being the active entity. This most likely means a player was holding it but has switched away or dropped it (in which case dropped = true)

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseCarriable.CreateViewModel

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseCarriable.DestroyViewModel
member.summary: We're done with the viewmodel - delete it

member.summary: Base entity with phyiscal properties, enables imapct damage and the like

member.name: T:Sandbox.BaseViewModel
member.summary: A common base we can use for weapons so we don't have to implement the logic over and over again.

member.name: T:Sandbox.BaseWeapon
member.summary: A common base we can use for weapons so we don't have to implement the logic over and over again. Feel free to not use this and to implement it however you want to.

member.name: P:Sandbox.BaseTrigger.OnEndTouch
member.summary: Fired when an entity stops touching this trigger. Only entities that passed this trigger's filters will cause this output to fire.

member.summary: Fired when an entity starts touching this trigger while no other passing entities are touching it.

member.name: P:Sandbox.BaseTrigger.OnEndTouchAll
member.summary: Fired when all entities touching this trigger have stopped touching it.

member.summary: Disables this trigger

member.summary: Toggles this trigger between enabled and disabled states

member.summary: Returns true if we have this event

member.name: M:Sandbox.PawnController.AddEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Allows the controller to pass events to other systems while staying abstracted. For example, it could pass a "jump" event, which could then be picked up by the playeranimator to trigger a jump animation, and picked up by the player to play a jump sound.

member.name: M:Sandbox.PawnController.BuildInput(Sandbox.InputBuilder)
member.summary: Allow the controller to tweak input. Empty by default

member.name: T:Sandbox.Player
member.summary: This is what you should derive your player from. This base exists in addon code so we can take advantage of codegen for replication. The side effect is that we can put stuff in here that we don't need to access from the engine - which gives more transparency to our code.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Player.Controller
member.summary: The PlayerController takes player input and moves the player. This needs to match between client and server. The client moves the local player and then checks that when the server moves the player, everything is the same. This is called prediction. If it doesn't match the player resets everything to what the server did, that's a prediction error. You should really never manually set this on the client - it's replicated so that setting the class on the server will automatically network and set it on the client.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Player.DevController
member.summary: This is used for noclip mode

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.GetActiveController
member.summary: Return the controller to use. Remember any logic you use here needs to match on both client and server. This is called as an accessor every tick.. so maybe avoid creating new classes here or you're gonna be making a ton of garbage!

member.name: P:Sandbox.Player.Animator
member.summary: The player animator is responsible for positioning/rotating the player and interacting with the animation graph.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.GetActiveAnimator
member.summary: Return the controller to use. Remember any logic you use here needs to match on both client and server. This is called as an accessor every tick.. so maybe avoid creating new classes here or you're gonna be making a ton of garbage!

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.Simulate(Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: Called every tick to simulate the player. This is called on the client as well as the server (for prediction). So be careful!

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.OnKilled
member.summary: Called once the player's health reaches 0

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.Respawn
member.summary: Sets LifeState to Alive, Health to Max, nulls velocity, and calls Gamemode.PlayerRespawn

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.CreateHull
member.summary: Create a physics hull for this player. The hull stops physics objects and players passing through the player. It's basically a big solid box. It also what hits triggers and stuff. The player doesn't use this hull for its movement size.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.BuildInput(Sandbox.InputBuilder)
member.summary: Called from the gamemode, clientside only.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Player.Corpse
member.summary: A generic corpse entity

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.PostCameraSetup(Sandbox.CameraSetup@)
member.summary: Called after the camera setup logic has run. Allow the player to do stuff to the camera, or using the camera. Such as positioning entities relative to it, like viewmodels etc.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.OnAnimEventFootstep(Vector3,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: A foostep has arrived!

member.name: P:Sandbox.Player.LastActiveChild
member.summary: This isn't networked, but it's predicted. If it wasn't then when the prediction system re-ran the commands LastActiveChild would be the value set in a future tick, so ActiveEnd and ActiveStart would get called mulitple times and out of order, causing all kinds of pain.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.SimulateActiveChild(Sandbox.Client,Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: Simulated the active child. This is important because it calls ActiveEnd and ActiveStart. If you don't call these things, viewmodels and stuff won't work, because the entity won't know it's become the active entity.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.OnActiveChildChanged(Sandbox.Entity,Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: Called when the Active child is detected to have changed

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.TickPlayerUse
member.summary: This should be called somewhere in your player's tick to allow them to use entities

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.UseFail
member.summary: Player tried to use something but there was nothing there. Tradition is to give a dissapointed boop.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.StopUsing
member.summary: If we're using an entity, stop using it

member.name: M:Sandbox.Player.FindUsable
member.summary: Find a usable entity for this player to use

member.name: T:Sandbox.Prop
member.summary: A prop that physically simulates as a single rigid body. It can be constrained to other physics objects using hinges or other constraints. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_dynamic (i.e. it should not be physically simulated) then it CANNOT be used as a prop_physics. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_dynamic instead.

member.summary: Simple Skybox

member.summary: Fancy dynamic sky

Sets the procedural hit creation parameters for the animgraph node, which makes the model twitch according to where it got hit.
The parameters set are
bool hit int hit_bone vector hit_offset vector hit_direction vector hit_strength

member.summary: Add a cube to the vertex buffer. Will include indices if they're enabled.

member.name: T:Sandbox.Game
member.summary: This is the main base game

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.Shutdown
member.summary: Called when the game is shutting down

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.ClientJoined(Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: Client has joined the server. Create their puppets.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.ClientDisconnect(Sandbox.Client,Sandbox.NetworkDisconnectionReason)
member.summary: Client has disconnected from the server. Remove their entities etc.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.Simulate(Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: Called each tick. Serverside: Called for each client every tick Clientside: Called for each tick for local client. Can be called multiple times per tick.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.FrameSimulate(Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: Called each frame on the client only to simulate things that need to be updated every frame. An example of this would be updating their local pawn's look rotation so it updates smoothly instead of at tick rate.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.CanHearPlayerVoice(Sandbox.Client,Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: Should we send voice data to this player

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.FindActiveCamera
member.summary: Which camera should we be rendering from?

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.DoPlayerSuicide(Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: Player typed kill in the console. Override if you don't want players to be allowed to kill themselves.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.DoPlayerNoclip(Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: Player typed noclip in the console.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.DoPlayerDevCam(Sandbox.Client)
member.summary: The player wants to enable the devcam. Probably shouldn't allow this unless you're in a sandbox mode or they're a dev.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.BuildCamera(Sandbox.CameraSetup)
member.summary: Called to set the camera up, clientside only.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.BuildInput(Sandbox.InputBuilder)
member.summary: Clientside only. Called every frame to process the input. The results of this input are encoded\ into a user command and passed to the PlayerController both clientside and serverside. This routine is mainly responsible for taking input from mouse/controller and building look angles and move direction.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.PostCameraSetup(Sandbox.CameraSetup@)
member.summary: Called after the camera setup logic has run. Allow the gamemode to do stuff to the camera, or using the camera. Such as positioning entities relative to it, like viewmodels etc.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.PostLevelLoaded
member.summary: Called right after the level is loaded and all entities are spawned.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.OnVoicePlayed(System.UInt64,System.Single)
member.summary: Someone is speaking via voice chat. This might be someone in your game, or in your party, or in your lobby.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.MoveToSpawnpoint(Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: This entity is probably a pawn, and would like to be placed on a spawnpoint. If you were making a team based game you'd want to choose the spawn based on team. Or not even call this. Up to you. Added as a convenience.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.OnKilled(Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: An entity has been killed. This is usually a pawn but anything can call it.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.OnKilled(Sandbox.Client,Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: An entity, which is a pawn, and has a client, has been killed.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Game.OnKilledMessage(System.UInt64,System.String,System.UInt64,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called clientside from OnKilled on the server to add kill messages to the killfeed.

member.name: T:Sandbox.MoveHelper
member.summary:
This is the HL2 style movement. If moving from position using Velocity results in a collision velocity will be changed to slide across the surface where appropriate. Position will be updated to the optimal position.
This is coded to be simple on purpose. It's enough to get your started. Once you reach the point where it's lacking you should copy and paste it into your project and specialize to your needs.
Give it a position and velocity, set the Trace up how you want to use it, then you're good to go.

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.#ctor(Vector3,Vector3)
member.summary: Create the movehelper and initialize it with the default settings. You can change Trace and MaxStandableAngle after creation.
member.example: var move = new MoveHelper( Position, Velocity )

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.TraceFromTo(Vector3,Vector3)
member.summary: Trace this from one position to another

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.TraceDirection(Vector3)
member.summary: Trace this from its current Position to a delta

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.TryMove(System.Single)
member.summary: Try to move to the position. Will return the fraction of the desired velocity that we travelled. Position and Velocity will be what we recommend using.

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.IsFloor(Sandbox.TraceResult)
member.summary: Return true if this is the trace is a floor. Checks hit and normal angle.

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.ApplyFriction(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Apply an amount of friction to the velocity

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.TraceMove(Vector3)
member.summary: Move our position by this delta using trace. If we hit something we'll stop, we won't slide across it nicely like TryMove does.

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.TryMoveWithStep(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Like TryMove but will also try to step up if it hits a wall

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.TryUnstuck
member.summary: Test whether we're stuck, and if we are then unstuck us

member.name: M:Sandbox.MoveHelper.Unstuck
member.summary: We're inside something solid, lets try to get out of it.

member.name: T:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes
member.summary: Used to store a list of planes that an object is going to hit, and then remove velocity from them so the object can slide over the surface without going through any of the planes.

member.name: P:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes.Max
member.summary: Maximum number of plasnes that can be hit

member.name: P:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes.Count
member.summary: Number of planes we're currently holding

member.name: M:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes.TryAdd(Vector3,Vector3@,System.Single)
member.summary: Try to add this plane and restrain velocity to it (and its brothers)
member.returns: False if we ran out of room and should stop adding planes

member.name: M:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes.TryClip(Vector3@)
member.summary: Try to clip our velocity to all the planes, so we're not travelling into them Returns true if we clipped properly

member.name: M:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes.MovingTowardsAnyPlane(Vector3,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if we're moving towards any of our planes (except for skip)

member.name: M:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes.StartBump(Vector3)
member.summary: Start a new bump. Clears planes and resets BumpVelocity

member.name: M:Sandbox.VelocityClipPlanes.ClipVelocity(Vector3,Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Clip the velocity to the normal

member.name: F:Sandbox.BasePlayerController.TraceOffset
member.summary: Any bbox traces we do will be offset by this amount. todo: this needs to be predicted

member.name: M:Sandbox.BasePlayerController.TraceBBox(Vector3,Vector3,Vector3,Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Traces the bbox and returns the trace result. LiftFeet will move the start position up by this amount, while keeping the top of the bbox at the same position. This is good when tracing down because you won't be tracing through the ceiling above.

member.name: M:Sandbox.BasePlayerController.TraceBBox(Vector3,Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: This calls TraceBBox with the right sized bbox. You should derive this in your controller if you want to use the built in functions

member.name: M:Sandbox.BasePlayerController.GetHull
member.summary: This is temporary, get the hull size for the player's collision

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.GetHull
member.summary: This is temporary, get the hull size for the player's collision

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.UpdateBBox
member.summary: Update the size of the bbox. We should really trigger some shit if this changes.

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.Accelerate(Vector3,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Add our wish direction and speed onto our velocity

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.ApplyFriction(System.Single)
member.summary: Remove ground friction from velocity

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.UpdateGroundEntity(Sandbox.TraceResult)
member.summary: We have a new ground entity

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.ClearGroundEntity
member.summary: We're no longer on the ground, remove it

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.TraceBBox(Vector3,Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Traces the current bbox and returns the result. liftFeet will move the start position up by this amount, while keeping the top of the bbox at the same position. This is good when tracing down because you won't be tracing through the ceiling above.

member.name: M:Sandbox.WalkController.StayOnGround
member.summary: Try to keep a walking player on the ground when running down slopes etc

member.name: M:Sandbox.UI.Button.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Calls Text = value

member.name: P:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.ItemSize
member.summary: The fixed size of each item. If x is lower than 0 then we'll stretch to fill the size.

member.name: P:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.AutoColumns
member.summary: Should we update Columns automatically?

member.name: P:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.Columns
member.summary: How many columns should we have?

member.summary: The Rect of this layout. Set via Update.

member.name: P:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.ScrollOffset
member.summary: Where the top of the visible space is

member.name: P:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.Justify
member.summary: How columns should be justified

member.name: M:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.Update(Rect,System.Single,Sandbox.UI.Justify)
member.summary: Update specifics of this layout. Returns true if we're dirty.

member.name: M:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.GetVisibleRange(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the range of cells that are visible

member.name: M:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.GetPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the position of this cell

member.name: M:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.Position(System.Int32,Sandbox.UI.Panel)
member.summary: Move this panel into the position. This will set the Left/Top/Width/Height on the panel

member.name: M:Sandbox.UI.Tests.GridLayout.GetHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the full height if we have this many items

member.name: T:Sandbox.UI.Tests.VirtualScrollPanel
member.summary:
Scroll panel that creates its contents as they become visible
TODO: we need to let panels know, or recreate them, when Data changes

member.name: M:Sandbox.UI.Tests.VirtualScrollPanel.HasData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return true if we have this data slot

member.name: P:Sandbox.UI.Tests.VirtualScrollPanel.OnCreateCell
member.summary: Create a new panel. You should add a child to the passed panel (which is the cell).

member.name: P:Sandbox.UI.TextEntry.AutoComplete
member.summary: If you hook a method up here we'll do autocomplete on it

member.name: F:Sandbox.UI.TextEntry.TimeSinceNotInFocus
member.summary: Keep tabs of when we were focused so we can flash the caret rative to that time. We want the caret to be visible immediately on focus

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.CanAdd(Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: Return true if this item belongs in the inventory

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.DeleteContents
member.summary: Delete every entity we're carrying. Useful to call on death.

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.GetSlot(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the item in this slot

member.summary: Returns the number of items in the inventory

member.summary: Returns the index of the currently active child

member.summary: Try to pick this entity up

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.OnChildAdded(Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: A child has been added to the Owner (player). Do we want this entity in our inventory? Yeah? Add it then.

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.OnChildRemoved(Sandbox.Entity)
member.summary: A child has been removed from our Owner. This might not even be in our inventory, if it is then we'll remove it from our list

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.SetActiveSlot(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set our active entity to the entity on this slot

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.SwitchActiveSlot(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Switch to the slot next to the slot we have active.

member.name: M:Sandbox.BaseInventory.DropActive
member.summary: Drop the active entity. If we can't drop it, will return null

member.summary: Drop this entity. Will return true if successfully dropped.

member.name: P:Sandbox.BaseInventory.Active
member.summary: Returns the active entity

member.summary: Make this entity the active one

member.summary: Try to add this entity to the inventory. Will return true if the entity was added successfully.
